message.content:
We only need to consider the initial records (the ones with an id starting with "Initial20231231001") because these represent the paid‐in capital contributions. In this case the three initial contributions are:

• Cash deposit: 5,000,000.0  
• Bank deposit: 15,000,000.0  
• Fixed Assets: 8,000,000.0

Adding these we obtain:  
5,000,000.0 + 15,000,000.0 + 8,000,000.0 = 28,000,000.0

None of the subsequent transactions (purchases, expenses, sales, transfers, etc.) change the paid‐in capital, so the final value remains the same.

Thus, the solution is:

{
  "solution": {
    "Paid-in Capital Initial Value": "28000000.00",
    "Paid-in Capital End Value": "28000000.00"
  }
}
